query: What is the purpose of the IJCAI 2023 conference?
output: The purpose of the IJCAI 2023 conference is to serve as the premier international gathering of AI researchers, providing a platform to communicate the advances and achievements of artificial intelligence research. It also aims to provide a structured setting for discussing specialized technical topics and promote an active exchange of ideas among attendees. Additionally, it includes a doctoral consortium to expose students to different areas of AI research and help build professional connections within the international community of AI researchers.

query: What are the eligibility criteria for students wishing to participate in the IJCAI Student Volunteer Program?
output: The eligibility criteria for students wishing to participate in the IJCAI Student Volunteer Program is that they must be a full-time university student, at any level. They may apply to participate whether or not they are presenting a paper, but priority will be given to students who have an accepted contribution to the IJCAI including main conference, workshop, tutorial, competition, and so on.

query: Where should papers be submitted for the "AI The Arts And Creativity" at IJCAI 2023?
output: Papers for the "AI The Arts And Creativity" at IJCAI 2023 should be submitted at https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IJCAI2023/.

query: What is the primary focus of the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track at IJCAI 2023?
output: The primary focus of the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track at IJCAI 2023 is to encourage the application of artificial intelligence to solve current global and local challenges, with particular attention to research triggered by real-world key questions. This research is expected to be carried out in collaboration with civil society stakeholders, using AI to work towards the SDGs and the Leave No One Behind (LNOB) principle. The track also aims to strengthen the civil society-science-policy interface and values multidisciplinary research, including collaborations with NGOs, community organizations, and government agencies.

query: What are the eligibilities for applying for student travel award
output: The eligibilities for applying for the student travel award include being a student, having a letter of support from the applicant's advisor or head of department, and there may be a consideration of whether any other sources of support are available to the applicant. Preference will be given to students and other applicants who have an accepted technical paper, and then to students and other applicants who are actively participating in the conference in some way. A post-conference report and receipts totaling the grant amount will also be required after the conference in order to receive the grant.

query: Can the conference provide visa letter for attendees?
output: Yes, the conference can provide a letter of invitation for visa to attendees. This can be obtained at the time of registration, and attendees are required to have their passport ready. Attendees who require this letter should email their personal details along with a copy of their travel document or passport to andrew@iccmacao.com. The request will be processed within 72 working hours. Please note that visa letters are only issued to registrants who have already paid their fees.

query: How will The IJCAI 2023 handle submissions of research project proposals in the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track?
output: The IJCAI 2023 will not expect research project proposals to present research results. However, selected proposals will have to report on their progress during the subsequent editions of IJCAI from 2024 to 2026 and submit a research paper to one of these conference editions. Selected proposals from the "AI and Social Good" track will be presented to a panel of government officials, NGOs, and private companies at IJCAI 2023 to receive feedback on the project implementation plan and any follow-up actions.

query: What is the deadline for registration
output:
The overall deadline for registration to attend IJCAI2023 is different based on the type of registration. The deadline for early registration is June 19, 2023 at 23:59 pm AoE. Late registration is open from June 20 – July 19, 2023 until 23:59 pm AoE. Onsite registration is open from July 19 – August 25, 2023 until noon, CST. 

For certain specific programs such as the competitions and challenges, there may be different registration deadlines. For instance, one competition has a deadline of May 5, 2023, another one has a deadline of May 10th, 2023 and other competition has a deadline of August 11th, 2023. 

So it largely depends on which event within IJCAI2023 you're referring to.

query: What are the requirements for submitting research papers to the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track?
output: Research papers for the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track must adhere to the same format as for the main conference, which is 7 pages plus 2 additional pages for references. Technical appendices such as datasets and code are permitted. Papers must satisfy the highest scientific standards, similar to regular submissions to the main track of IJCAI 2023. In addition, these papers are expected to provide multidisciplinary scientific contributions towards the UN SDGs and LNOB principle and refer to work done by or with NGOs, community organizations, and government agencies. The presentation of case studies is encouraged to demonstrate practical contributions and examples of translating global goals into local actions. Papers should be submitted anonymously. Unlike the main track, there is no author rebuttal phase and no summary reject phase. Accepted papers will be included in the IJCAI proceedings, and there will be an award for outstanding research papers in this track.

query: What are the requirements for submitting research papers to the "AI The Arts And Creativity" special track?
output: The requirements for submitting research papers to the "AI The Arts And Creativity" special track are as follows: The research papers must be submitted in the same format and follow the general instructions as for the main conference (as described on https://ijcai-23.org/call-for-papers/). There will be no summary reject phase and no rebuttal, and it is not required to upload extra files for previously rejected papers. The submissions must meet all the Submission Requirements described in the general instructions. In particular, the submissions must be anonymous, and are expected to meet the highest scientific standards as submissions to the main track of IJCAI 2023. Double submissions to the special track and the main conference are not allowed. The submission deadline is February 1, 2023. Submissions can be made at https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IJCAI2023/. Accepted research papers will be included in the IJCAI 2023 proceedings.
